did.abstract: This collection contains the papers of Sidney and Clara Solomon. Sidney and Clara Solomon were both New York anarchists and were members of the Vanguard Group in the 1930s and the New Trends Group in the 1940s. This collection most notably contains many letters from Emma Goldman and some other correspondence from John Dewey. The collection also contains some materials, including minutes, from the Vanguard Group and some flyers pertaining to leftist causes like Spanish labor and relief in the 1930s. The materials span from the 1920s to the 1940s.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Sidney and Clara Solomon were both New York anarchists and were members of the Vanguard Group in the 1930s and the New Trends Group in the 1940s. The Vanguard Group was a New York anarcho-communist group, which published a magazine called Vanguard and dissipated during World War II.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The Tamiment Library does not have information about who owns copyright to this collection. Materials in this collection are expected to enter the public domain beginning in 2040. The Tamiment Library is not authorized to grant permission to publish or reproduce materials from this collection.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Collection likely donated by Sidney and Clara Solomon, circa 1996. The accession numbers associated with this collection are 1996.004 and 2006.061.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: Minutes from several 1939 Vanguard Group meetings were separated from this collection during initial processing and were established as a separate collection, the Vanguard Group Minutes (TAM 389). In 2015, the Vanguard collection was reincorporated into the Sidney and Clara Slomon Papers.
